Package info.dnsdb.client

Class HTTPClient

java.lang.Object
info.dnsdb.client.HTTPClient
All Implemented Interfaces:
Client
public class HTTPClient extends Object implements Client
Implementation of a DNSDB 2.0 with Flexible Search client.
Author:
Farsight Security, Inc. <support@farsightsecurity.com>
See Also:
Farsight DNSDB API Documentation.

  • Field Details

    • DEFAULT_SERVER

      public static final String DEFAULT_SERVER
      The default server for the DNSDB API.
      See Also:
      Constant Field Values

  • Constructor Details

    • HTTPClient

      public HTTPClient​(String apikey)
      Class constructor specifying an API key and using the default server and HTTP client.
      Parameters:
      apikey - Access token for the DNSDB service.

    • HTTPClient

      public HTTPClient​(String apikey, String server)
      Class constructor specifying an API key and an alternate server URI.
      Parameters:
      apikey - Access token for the DNSDB service.
      server - Base URI for the DNSDB server.

    • HTTPClient

      public HTTPClient​(String apikey, String server, HttpClient client)
      Class constructor specifying an API key, an alternate server URI, and a specific HttpClient. One may want to override the latter if testing, or for network environments requiring proxies.
      Parameters:
      apikey - Access token for the DNSDB service.
      server - Base URI for the DNSDB server.
      client - HttpClient used for connections to the DNSDB server.

  • Method Details

    • ping

      public boolean ping()
      Calls the DNSDB ping endpoint to verify end-to-end connectivity, but not apikey validity.
      Specified by:
      ping in interface Client
      Returns:
      True if the client can connect to the DNSDB API server and the ping endpoint executes successfully, false otherwise.
      See Also:
      Documentation for the ping endpoint., if you need to test your apikey.

    • rateLimit

      public org.json.JSONObject rateLimit()
      Calls the DNSDB rate_limit endpoint to obtain information about service limits.
      Specified by:
      rateLimit in interface Client
      Returns:
      Returns a JSONObject corresponding to the output format of the DNSDB rate_limit endpoint.
      Throws:
      DNSDBException - If the connection fails or a non-OK (200) status code is returned.
      See Also:
      Documentation for the service limits API and output format.

    • lookupRRSet

      public Query lookupRRSet​(String type, String value)
      Creates a Query object for a lookup RRSet search of type name or raw for the given value.
      Specified by:
      lookupRRSet in interface Client
      Parameters:
      type - One of TYPE_NAME or TYPE_IP.
      value - A domain name with or without wildcards or a hex-encoded raw rrname string.
      Returns:
      A Query object set up with the desired parameters.
      See Also:
      Documentation for rrset lookups.

    • lookupRData

      public Query lookupRData​(String type, String value)
      Creates a Query object for a lookup RData search of type name, ip, or raw for the given value.
      Specified by:
      lookupRData in interface Client
      Parameters:
      type - One of TYPE_NAME, TYPE_IP, or TYPE_RAW.
      value - A domain name with or without wildcards, an IP address with or without CIDR notation, or a hex-encoded raw rrname string.
      Returns:
      A Query object set up with the desired parameters.
      See Also:
      Documentation for rdata lookups.

    • flex

      public Query flex​(String method, String key, String value)
      Creates a Query object for a flexible search of method regex or glob, key of rrnames or rdata, for the given value.
      Specified by:
      flex in interface Client
      Parameters:
      method - One of METHOD_REGEX or METHOD_GLOB.
      key - One of KEY_RRNAMES or KEY_RDATA.
      value - A regular expression or glob to search for.
      Returns:
      A Query object set up with the desired parameters.
      See Also:
      Flexible Search Reference Guide., Flexible Search API Programmers Guide., DNSDB FCRE Reference Guide., DNSDB Glob Reference Guide.
